Class HangmanGame

      boolean makeGuess(char ch)
      Simulates the player guessing a letter in the word and updates the state of game accordingly -- number of guesses remaining, number of letters remaining to be guessed, the state of the secret word, and list of letters guessed.
      NOTES on GAME LOGIC:
      if the guessed letter is not in the word, and hasn't been guessed yet, numGuesses is decremented if the guessed letter is in the word, and hasn't been guessed yet, then update the current state of the guessed word to reveal the position(s) of the letter(s) that was just guessed, and update numLettersRemaining.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HangmanGame

        public HangmanGame(java.lang.String secretWord,
                   int numGuesses)
        Constructor sets up the game to be played with a word and some number of guesses. The class should have private variables that keep track of:
      • The original secret word
      • The number of guesses remaining
      • The number of letters that still need to be guessed
      • The current state of word to be guessed (e.g. "L A B _ R A _ _ R Y")
Parameters:
secretWord - the word that the player is trying to guess
numGuesses - the number of guesses allowed

  • Method Detail

    • getSecretWord

      public java.lang.String getSecretWord()
      Returns:
      the original secret word.

    • makeGuess

      public boolean makeGuess(char ch)
      Simulates the player guessing a letter in the word and updates the state of game accordingly -- number of guesses remaining, number of letters remaining to be guessed, the state of the secret word, and list of letters guessed.
      NOTES on GAME LOGIC:
    • if the guessed letter is not in the word, and hasn't been guessed yet, numGuesses is decremented
    • if the guessed letter is in the word, and hasn't been guessed yet, then update the current state of the guessed word to reveal the position(s) of the letter(s) that was just guessed, and update numLettersRemaining.
    • There should be no guess penalty for guessing a letter that has already been guessed - but should still return true/false that the char is/isn't in the word.
Parameters:
ch - the char that is the next letter to be guessed on the word
Returns:
true if the game isn't over and the guessed letter was in the word, false otherwise

  • isWin

    public boolean isWin()
    Returns:
    true if there are no more letters to be guessed and there is still at least one guess remaining

  • gameOver

    public boolean gameOver()
    Returns:
    true if either num guesses remaining is 0 or num letters remaining to be guessed is 0.

  • numGuessesRemaining

    public int numGuessesRemaining()
    Returns:
    the number of guesses the player has left

  • numLettersRemaining

    public int numLettersRemaining()
    The number of letters remaining to be guessed in the secret word - i.e. the number of blank spaces the player sees, which may be different from the actually number of letters it will take to fill those blanks.
    Returns:
    the number of letters in the secret word that still have to be guessed

  • displayGameState

    public java.lang.String displayGameState()
    Gives a display-ready String-ified version of the current state of the secret word, showing letters that have been guessed and blank spaces for letters that still need to be guessed. For example if the secret word is "LABORATORY" and the player has guessed L, A, B, R, and Y the method might return something like "L A B _ R A _ _ R Y"
    Returns:
    a String of the current state of the secret word.

  • lettersGuessed

    public java.lang.String lettersGuessed()
    A String representing the letters guessed so far in the order they were guessed. Duplicates should not be added.
    Returns:
    a String showing which letters have already been guessed.
